content.question: Let f and g be functions that are differentiable for all real numbers x and that have the following properties. (i) f′(x) = f(x) − g(x) (ii) g′(x) = g(x) − f(x) (iii) f(0) = 5 (iv) g(0) = 1 (a) Prove that f(x) + g(x) = 6 for all x.

frqParts.text: Let f and g be functions that are differentiable for all real numbers x and that have the following properties. (i) f′(x) = f(x) − g(x) (ii) g′(x) = g(x) − f(x) (iii) f(0) = 5 (iv) g(0) = 1 (a) Prove that f(x) + g(x) = 6 for all x.
(b) Find f(x) and g(x). Show your work.

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
